revised_title: Strophanthidin's Effect on Sodium Efflux in Dialyzed Axons
tldr: The study examines the effect of strophanthidin on sodium efflux in dialyzed axons. It shows that the efflux depends on the external cation composition and suggests that strophanthidin induces a monovalent cation/Na exchange. The results indicate that ATP is required for the Na-Ca exchange.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
